The International Progresses, Developmen.context2: Abstract:More and more literature has been written on electronic records management(ERM) inrecent years,however，much is limited to experiences of one country ora few with more focus on electronic records management systems(ERMS),either from IT perspectives or records and archives management perspectives.Literature review and case studies of representative policies，regulations,best practices guidelines from Australia,Canada,New Zealand,UK and U.S published after 2O08 show problems and chalenges of ERM in e-government are geting more and more recognized in e-government agenda.Current trends of ERM i e-government are toward multidisciplinaryand colaborative approaches to ERM managing records as information resources and business asset.Findings indicate that future directions of ERM in e-government would be toward meta-synthesis management at both organizational and national level,with integration concerns of collaboration,optimization and innovation of both ERM and e-government for civil service.
